perturbation.original_text:
(a)  HCI shall pay MLX a guaranteed fixed sum of [*] US per annum during the
     Initial Term of this Agreement to be paid out as a monthly payment of [*]
     US (the "Monthly Payment"). This Monthly Payment shall be due by the 10th
     day of each month余
perturbation.changed_text:
(a)  HCI shall pay MLX a guaranteed fixed sum of [*] US per annum during the
     Initial Term of this Agreement to be paid out as a monthly payment of [*]
     US (the "Monthly Payment"). This Monthly Payment shall be due by the 10th
     day of each month; however, if HCI provides supporting documentation of financial hardship, the payment due date can be extended to the 25th day of the month.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that monthly payments are due by the 10th of each month, but then adding a clause that allows for extension of the due date to the 25th of the month under certain circumstances. This creates uncertainty as to when payments are actually due, leading to potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
11.2  Termination
(a)  Either Party may terminate this Agreement upon 30 days prior written notice
     to the other Party if 1) such other Party breaches any material term of
     this Agreement, unless such breach is cured within 30 days余 or 2) if any of
     the terms of this Agreement that require mutual approval are not mutually
     agreed to余
perturbation.changed_text:
11.2  Termination
(a)  Either Party may terminate this Agreement upon 30 days prior written notice
     to the other Party if 1) such other Party breaches any material term of
     this Agreement, unless such breach is cured within 30 days余 or 2) if any of
     the terms of this Agreement that require mutual approval are not mutually
     agreed to; however, termination based on failure to mutually agree to terms requiring mutual approval is only permissible within the first year of the Term.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause allows termination for failure to mutually agree on terms, while the added text restricts this reason for termination to only the first year of the agreement. This contradicts the initial clause, creating uncertainty about when termination is allowed and under what conditions.

perturbation.original_text:
24.  SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS
Except as provided in this Section, neither Party may assign its rights or
obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other
Party, which shall not be unreasonably withheld. Notwithstanding the foregoing,
either party shall be permitted to assign this Agreement and any of its rights
and obligations hereunder to an affiliate or related company or to a purchaser
of all or substantially all of its Internet business, without obtaining the
prior written consent of the other party.
perturbation.changed_text:
24.  SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS
Except as provided in this Section, neither Party may assign its rights or
obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other
Party, which shall not be unreasonably withheld. Notwithstanding the foregoing,
either party shall be permitted to assign this Agreement and any of its rights
and obligations hereunder to an affiliate or related company or to a purchaser
of all or substantially all of its Internet business, without obtaining the
prior written consent of the other party. However, any assignment to an affiliate requires a written notification to the other party within 10 business days of the assignment.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause allows assignment to affiliates without consent, while the added text imposes a requirement of written notification within 10 business days of the assignment. This notification requirement creates an inconsistency, as the original clause implies no such notification is necessary. This ambiguity creates uncertainty regarding the conditions of assignment.
